repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body: Until #27693 is merged, we should report misbehaving servers that don't respect the client capability and sends Markup diagnostic messages.

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -110,14 +110,22 @@ local function diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id)
   return vim.tbl_map(function(diagnostic)
     local start = diagnostic.range.start
     local _end = diagnostic.range['end']
+    local message ---@type string
+    if type(diagnostic.message) == 'string' then
+      ---@cast diagnostic { message: string }
+      message = diagnostic.message
+    else
+      vim.lsp.log.info(string.format('Unsupported Markup message from LSP client %d', client_id))

@@ -110,14 +110,22 @@ local function diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id)
   return vim.tbl_map(function(diagnostic)
     local start = diagnostic.range.start
     local _end = diagnostic.range['end']
+    local message ---@type string
+    if type(diagnostic.message) == 'string' then
+      ---@cast diagnostic { message: string }
+      message = diagnostic.message

@@ -110,14 +110,22 @@ local function diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id)
   return vim.tbl_map(function(diagnostic)
     local start = diagnostic.range.start
     local _end = diagnostic.range['end']
+    local message ---@type string
+    if type(diagnostic.message) == 'string' then
+      ---@cast diagnostic { message: string }
+      message = diagnostic.message

comment_data.body: I'd tend to turn this even into an error using `vim.notify_once`. If a server returns markdown diagnostic messages without the client advertising the capability it is clearly a bug in the server
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -110,14 +110,22 @@ local function diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id)
   return vim.tbl_map(function(diagnostic)
     local start = diagnostic.range.start
     local _end = diagnostic.range['end']
+    local message ---@type string
+    if type(diagnostic.message) == 'string' then
+      ---@cast diagnostic { message: string }
+      message = diagnostic.message
+    else
+      vim.lsp.log.info(string.format('Unsupported Markup message from LSP client %d', client_id))

comment_data.body: Sounds good. I used `log` because that's what we use for unknown `DiagnosticTag`s, which are technically really bad since the supported set is also announced via capabilities.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -110,14 +110,22 @@ local function diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id)
   return vim.tbl_map(function(diagnostic)
     local start = diagnostic.range.start
     local _end = diagnostic.range['end']
+    local message ---@type string
+    if type(diagnostic.message) == 'string' then
+      ---@cast diagnostic { message: string }
+      message = diagnostic.message
+    else
+      vim.lsp.log.info(string.format('Unsupported Markup message from LSP client %d', client_id))

comment_data.body: `.message` needs to be put into a intermediate variable for it to correctly narrow the type.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -110,14 +110,22 @@ local function diagnostic_lsp_to_vim(diagnostics, bufnr, client_id)
   return vim.tbl_map(function(diagnostic)
     local start = diagnostic.range.start
     local _end = diagnostic.range['end']
+    local message ---@type string
+    if type(diagnostic.message) == 'string' then
+      ---@cast diagnostic { message: string }
+      message = diagnostic.message

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
    local message = diagnostic.message
    if type(message) ~= 'string' then
      vim.notify_once(
        string.format('Unsupported Markup message from LSP client %d', client_id),
        vim.lsp.log_levels.ERROR
      )
      message = message.value
    end
```

To reflect the remark from @lewis6991

comment_regular_data.body: This should be ready to merge :) @mfussenegger @justinmk

title: fix(lsp): log when receiving markup messages
